results.title: The Technique of artificial pneumothorax
results.brief_description: Apparatus used in the operation of applying artificial pneumothorax treatment in pulmonary tuberculosis (controlled collapse of the infected lung). Shows the induction in the lung wall; the refill in the lung wall; explains the treatment necessary to effect a complete cure.

results.title: The Teaching triad (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: AIMS Instructional Media, Dubnoff Center, Jerry Maybrook, Susan Rafin and Lane Wipff
results.brief_description: Focuses on the direct involvement of the educational therapist with the family of the handicapped child as well as the child himself. Defines the teacher parent child component as the teaching triad and demonstrates ways teachers and parents together can help to bring the child to his optimal level of development.

results.title: The Teaching box
results.creator_credit: United States Information Agency and Stephen Ocko
results.brief_description: Describes the establishment of a revolutionary experiment in education which has been successfully launched in American Samoa - a group of six small islands. Seeking an expansion of their educational system, Samoans turned to closed circuit television for a solution. High quality education on both primary and secondary school levels is now transmitted daily throughout the islands.

results.title: The Teaching Ambassadors: International Teaching Fellowships
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Ministry of Education, Ivan Gaal and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: Looks at the International Fellowship Scheme which operates in Victoria. Highlights the professional development aspects of the project, the influence visiting participants have on school communities and the input gained by schools upon the return of Victorian recipients. Featured speakers include: Rex Murfett, Susan Gianevsky, Richard Wood, Alex McKnight and Kevin Collins.

results.title: The Teacher: authority or automaton?
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Richard Gilbert and Mort Ransen
results.brief_description: In our overflowing classrooms, are methods of mass production edging out traditional ways of education? This film offers a vocal sampling of opinion from across Canada. Teachers, administrators and high-ranking educators speak their minds freely about the problems facing education in Canada today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Richard Gilbert and Mort Ransen

results.title: The Teacher and Technology (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Use of audiovisual equipment in the classroom. The technical sophistication is not as important as the usage and the input. Stresses need for careful selection of media to suit specific learning experience and students involved

results.title: The Taxi driver
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Louis Portugais and Jean Roy
results.brief_description: Accompanies Gerry Lane, a taxi driver, on a few rides and presents a sampling of the parade of people, of all types and temperaments, that pass in and out of his cab in endless procession, all with very personal concerns but all with one thing in common - a desire to get somewhere in a hurry.

results.title: The Taste of others = It takes all kinds = Le Gout des autres
results.creator_credit: Les Films A4, France2 Cinema, Telema Productions, Canal+, Christian Berard, Charles Gassot and Agnes Jaoui
results.brief_description: This comedy, about the foibles of a disparate group of people whose lives intersect and are altered in unforseen ways, has a whimsical tone that is underpinned by an impressively deft script. Jean-Jacques Castella is a depressed industrialist married to an interior designer who dominates their personal spaces with her ‘taste’. Their unstable marriage cataclysmically implodes when Jean-Jacques attends a bourgeois play (against his will) subsequently falling in love with an aging actress. Clara for her part takes an immediate dislike to Jean-Jacques - considering him a materialistic, middle-class, tasteless bore. Added to this mix is Jean-Jacques’ bodyguard, who falls in with a free-spirited barmaid; his driver, coping with the trials of a long distance love affair; and Clara’s cultured friends who delight in mocking the gauche and unknowing Jean-Jacques. Thus whilst interrogating notions of class and taste, this comedy of manners is also a humanistic and wry portrayal of modern relationships, mores and ways. In her debut feature Agnes Jaoui ably captures the idiosyncrasies and muddled desires of her protagonists, without stooping to bland characterisations or pat conclusions. A contender for Best Foreign Film at the Academy Awards, “The Taste of others” won four Cesars (including Best Film) and was nominated for a further five. Cast includes Jean-Pierre Bacri, Anne Alvaro, Agnes Jaoui, Gerard Lanvin, Alain Chabat, Brigitte Catillon, Christiane Millet and Vladimir Yordanoff.
